result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell P Ruegsegger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of not guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued but was amended to : Defendant may have contact with CHandra C. as long the defendant is in the Dane County Jail.  If released, defendant may not have contact, direct or indirect with Chandra C.  All other conditions remain the same.
Copy given defendant, reading waived.
Branch 15

State moved for exclusion of witnesses - Court granted motion. Kevin Baer, DCSO Deputy - duly sworn & testified.  Direct exam by ADA Mimier.  Atty Van Rybroek stipulated to I.D. of defendant. Cross exam by Atty Van Rybroek. Redirect exam by ADA Mimier.  Recross exam by Atty Van Rybroek. Witness excused.  State moved for bind over - waived argument. Atty Van Rybroek objected - made argument.  Ct. found probable cause that a felony was committed by the defendant and ordered bindover.  Bail continued.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant may have contact with Chandra C as long as he is in the Dane Co Jail.  If released. the defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Chandra C. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact with J.C. unless it is supervised by a responsible adult.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
